results.title: Use and reuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”
How does a living organism relate to its environment? Dean learns about the ecological systems of the earth as he observes the ecological system of a fishbowl. He discovers how humans relate to their environment - how we use it, destroy it and restore it.

results.title: Use and care of books
results.brief_description: Uses cartoon animation to introduce students to books of various kinds, including library books and textbooks. Emphasizes correct ways of using, handling and protecting books. No other credits available.

results.title: US Navy Ciné-Kodak Special
results.brief_description: Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.

constellations_primary.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_primary.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

results.description: Footage captured during war has the ability to give audiences a sense of what is happening in combat, documenting the frontlines with an unflinching lens and bearing witness to atrocities. Yet it can also be used as propaganda to enlist forces, making it a powerful tool. Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933 following on from its earlier model the Ciné-Kodak in 1923. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.
description_for_label: Footage captured during war has the ability to give audiences a sense of what is happening in combat, documenting the frontlines with an unflinching lens and bearing witness to atrocities. Yet it can also be used as propaganda to enlist forces, making it a powerful tool. Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933 following on from its earlier model the Ciné-Kodak in 1923. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Partial Assembly
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This partially assembled camera shows the many tightly packed components, including thermal management, circuit boards, microphones, image sensor and light filters hidden inside the camera’s body.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Image Sensor Assembly and Chassis
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
The chassis is the main structural element of the camera, and is die-cast with a magnesium alloy that is very light and strong.

The image sensor assembly with its large liquid cooled radiator is shown here mounted to the front of the chassis.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Form Prototype
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This prototype was built using a combination of stereolithography (SLA) and full colour 3D printed parts, which were made from a powdered material solidified by an inkjet printing process over hundreds of layers. It was used by the Blackmagic Industrial Design team during the early stages of design process to evaluate the camera’s design and functionality.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: Around 2015, Emmy Award-winning filmmaker Jody Eldred tested a pre-production model of the BlackMagic URSA Mini 4.6K in the Las Vegas desert. Aside from his 40-year career in film and TV, Eldred had spent 15 years testing cameras. “Wow,” was his response to the camera’s quality, but he had a few suggestions for on how to improve it. Less than a year later the URSA Mini Pro 4.6k was released with those changes implemented. “I was stunned,” Eldred has said. He hadn’t encountered a camera company that listening to the people who use them.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
URSA Mini Pro is a professional digital film camera that combines high resolution
image quality with the features and controls of a traditional broadcast camera.
A highly versatile camera format, it’s been used in the creation of a number of
Hollywood productions, television and streaming series as well as studio and
live production events.
